title: Sarah Jessica Parker wears bizarre shoes and socks combo at Chemist Warehouse event in Melbourne
text:
She's known for playing the stylish Carrie Bradshaw in Sex and the City.

But on Wednesday, Sarah Jessica Parker stepped out in a rather bizarre ensemble, during a Chemist Warehouse event in Melbourne.

The 54-year-old star left some fans puzzled as she hit center stage wearing long purple socks with black block heels from her own line, which are worth a whopping $621 (AU).

Carrie would disapprove! Sarah Jessica Parker (pictured) wore a bizarre shoes and socks combo at her Chemist Warehouse fan event in Melbourne on Wednesday

The American actress also opted for a three-quarter floral dress which complimented her slender frame.

She showed off her ageless complexion, opting for a neutral makeup palette.

Sarah Jessica completed her look with an array of accessories including silver bracelets and a collection of rings and a chain around her neck.

Pushing the fashion boundaries! The Sex and the City star opted for a floral dress with her shoes and socks

The TV legend was greeted by hundreds of adoring fans, who chanted her name before she made her way to her fan event, where she was interviewed by media personality Jo Stanley.

The star is in Australia promoting her SJP shoe collection, which retail at David Jones.

Sarah Jessica told the Herald Sun on Tuesday that overzealous admirers often scare or freak her out, after she looked uncomfortable this week when fans flocked to get a closer look and pictures with her.

Popular! The TV legend was greeted by hundreds of adoring fans, who chanted her name before she made her way to her fan event, where she was interviewed by media personality Jo Stanley

Her take: Sarah Jessica told the Herald Sun on Tuesday that overzealous admirers often scare or freak her out, after she looked uncomfortable this week when fans flocked to get a closer look and pictures with her

'The world is scary a little bit right now, there's a heightened awareness, there's tension, so that's the only thing that freaks me out is people grabbing me. I much prefer conversation to a selfie,' she explained.

Sarah Jessica added: 'What's happening now is that people actually grab you, people want a selfie, so there's no exchange of, ''hello, how are you? Do you mind for a moment if we do a photograph?'' It's ''can we do a selfie?''

'There's no introduction and when they're doing it they're grabbing you,' Sarah Jessica clarified further.
description: She's known for playing the stylish Carrie Bradshaw in Sex and the City.
authors: Ali Daher For Daily Mail Australia
